content: “how closely real-world politics, and the politics of Star Wars” Superfluous comma. In fact, it impedes understand of your sentence. “parallel one another — a process” To parallel is not a process. Increasing to parallel would be one. “This article explores some of those parallels.” You’ve barely indicated one parallel. And now it’s plural? “The political parallels” Really fond of the word “parallel”, are we? Please hire an editor. Your writing interferes with your argument.
